intro: Glaucium corniculatum var. mauritanicum, commonly known as the Mauritania poppy, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes other well-known genera such as Papaver and Eschscholzia. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
